tn.text: The man in Ezekiel's vision ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:40:03|40:3]]) continues to show Ezekiel around the temple.
See how you translated these "long" cubits in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:40:05|40:05]].

tn.ref: to the front of the temple hall
tn.text: "like the width of the holy place" or "matching the width of the holy place"
"the side rooms of the priests that were further out from the sanctuary"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:40:28|40:31]].
"the balconies." The balconies were places that were built higher up than the rest of the building. People could go into balconies and look down on the main floor of the building.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:16|8:16]].
to make something beautiful usually by putting something on it

tn.ref: There were double doors for the holy place and the most holy place
tn.text: "the holy place and the most holy place both had two doors"

tn.ref: These doors had two hinged door panels each
tn.text: "Each door had two parts that were on hinges." Hinges connect doors to the wall and allow the doors to swing.

tn.ref: two panels for one door and two panels for the other
tn.text: "both of the doors for both the holy place and the most holy place had two parts"

tn.ref: just as the walls were decorated
tn.text: "just as the walls also had carvings of cherubim and palm trees"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:16|8:16]].
